item.title: Adding a crop or a variety to the experiment
item.description: 1. Select the type of cropping system of your experiment. Currently the choices are: Monocrop, Intercrop or Relay crop. 2. Select the crop’s common name. If the crop is not listed, select ‘’Other’’ and specify the crop common name. If “Intercrop” or “Relay crop” are selected, AgroFIMS will require you to add at least 2 crops. To add more, click on “add crop”. 3. Enter the variety name. You can enter as many varieties as needed.

item.title: Alerts
item.description: The alerts shortcode allows you to let information stand out by means of an alert styled box. This can be used to indicate danger, warning, success or info. I’m a danger alert I’m a warning alert I’m a success alert I’m an info alert Usage Place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< alert style="STYLE" >}} [content] {{< /alert >}} Parameters Style The style parameter is directly applied to the alert as a class in the format “alert-{STYLE}".

item.title: Managing your account
item.description: Signing Up Go to AgroFIMS. Enter your email, password, name, last name, organization and country. Click Create. Your account has been created. You can Log in and start using AgroFIMS. An email will be sent to your mailbox to confirm your account. Don’t forget to check your spam folder if you don’t see the email in your inbox! Logging in At the upper right corner of the Home page, click on and select Log In Enter your email and your password.

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: Effective date: January 01, 2020 WHAT TYPE OF PERSONAL DATA DO WE COLLECT FROM USERS AND HOW DO WE MANAGE IT? When signing up to AgroFIMS, we ask you for information such as your name, last name, email, name of organization you work with, and the country you live in. Providing this information is mandatory to create an account and use AgroFIMS. We respect user privacy; accordingly, any personally identifiable information you provide is protected by SSL encryption when it is exchanged with AgroFIMS and will only be used for internal purposes in accordance with site-specific policies, or in ways to which you have explicitly consented.

item.title: Buttons
item.description: The button shortcode allows you to add a button to the page. This button is a HTML anchor element and can thus be used to link to another page or website. Button Button Button Button Button Button Button Usage Place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< button style="STYLE" link="https://yourwebsite.com" >}} [content] {{< /button >}} Parameters style The style parameter is directly applied to the alert as a class in the format “btn-{STYLE}".

item.title: What is Fieldbook ID?
item.description: Fieldbook ID is a unique identifier created by AgroFIMS to identify your experiment. It is made of the concatenation of the following information: F_Cropping type_Crop name_Experiment start date_Country. “F” stands for Fieldbook in this case.

item.title: Childpages
item.description: The childpages shortcode allows you to show a list of sub-pages of the current page. For example, the Getting started page of this documentation has three child pages: Installation, Configuration and Creating content. Placing the childpages shortcode in the Getting started page will place a create a list of these sub-pages in that page. Usage Simply place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< childpages >}}

item.title: Code
item.description: Add code to your page with syntax highlighting and a copy button so your users can easily copy the code to their clipboard with the press of a button. The code may be entered inside the shortcode or come from an external file. Copy <div class="mydiv bg-primary shadow text-white"> <h1 class="title">Hi there</h1> <p class="lead">I'm inside a code shortcode. Check out my syntax highlighting!.</p> </div> Usage Simply place the following shortcode on the page

item.title: Collapse
item.description: Feel like hiding some content from your visitor in a collapsible element? The collapse shortcode does exactly that. It creates a button that shows or hides the content in the shortcode on request. Click me to show content Hi there, I'm the hidden content. Didn't see that one coming, huh? Usage Simply place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< collapse title="TITLE" >}} [content] {{< /collapse >}} Parameters title The lang parameter defines the text to show in the button that toggles the collapse content.

item.title: Doublecode
item.description: The doublecode shortcode works the same as the code shortcode, but extends the functionality by also rendering the code in the page. This is useful for showing the code of HTML elements in your page. Hi there I'm inside a doublecode shortcode, that's why I look so fancy. Copy <div class="mydiv bg-primary shadow text-white p-3 m-4 border-primary"> <p class="h4 title">Hi there</p> <p class="lead mb-0">I'm inside a doublecode shortcode, that's why I look so fancy.

item.title: Panel
item.description: Draw your visitor’s attention by separating information from the rest of the page using a panel. Convey meaning to this information by using colors implying danger, warning, success or info in a similar fashion as alerts. I'm important Be sure to read me, I might have important information for you. Usage Simply place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< panel title="TITLE" style="STYLE" >}} [content] {{< /panel >}} Parameters Style The style parameter is directly applied to the alert as a class in the format “border-{STYLE}".

item.description: This section is dedicated to the selection of weather measurements to make during the experiment. Selecting a weather measurement Select a measurement in the drop-down list. You can either scroll through the list or delete the default and type the name of your measurement – the auto-complete feature will select the term if the measurement is in the list. Once you have found your measurement, select it and click on .

item.title: Table
item.description: The table shortcode allows you to wrap your tables in a table class, providing styling to the table such as borders, stripes and hover effects. Tables are cool col 3 is right-aligned $1600 col 2 is centered $12 zebra stripes are neat $1 Usage Place the following shortcode on the page Copy {{< table style="STYLE" >}} | Tables | are | cool | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 | | col 2 is | centered | $12 | | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 | {{< /table >}} Parameters Style The style parameter is directly applied to the table as a class in the format "{STYLE}".
